trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.BeforeLabelEdit"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit"></xref> events.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LabelEditEventArgs> specifies the index and caption of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> and the caption after it has been edited by the user.
This class also provides a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LabelEditEventArgs.CancelEdit%2A> property.
You can use this property in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.BeforeLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event handler to prevent the user from editing the label.
You can also use it in an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event handler to revert the change, returning the label it to its original value.
This is useful when you want to validate user input before committing the change.

Because the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event takes place before the label edit is committed, calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a handler for this event will sort the item using the original value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LabelEditEventArgs"></xref> class with the specified index to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> to edit.

You can use this constructor when raising the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.BeforeLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event at run time to specify a specific list item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> to edit.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref>, containing the label to edit.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LabelEditEventArgs"></xref> class with the specified index to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> being edited and the new text for the label of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref>.

You can use this constructor when raising the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.BeforeLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event at run time to specify a list item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> to edit.
The constructor also enables you to specify the new text associated with the label of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem>.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref>, containing the label to edit.
The new text assigned to the label of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether changes made to the label of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> should be canceled.
You can use this property to cancel changes made to the label of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> and revert it to its original text.
Use this property to prevent an item's caption from being changed to a value that does not meet your application's requirements.
`true` if the edit operation of the label for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> should be canceled; otherwise `false`.
Gets the zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> containing the label to edit.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref>.
Gets the new text assigned to the label of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref>.
The new text to associate with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> or `null` if the text is unchanged.
